Reviews.Content: Misleading       The Fireplace
Reviews.Author: Ja5en

Reviews.Content: All is not as it seems The website makes this property appear to be a boutique hotel, but be warned, a lot of those photos are taken in public areas. Our balcony room was nothing like these pictures.On our arrival we were asked to pay for our entire 4 night stay before we were given a key - that should have been enough to start the alarm bells ringing. This experience has taught me that if a hotel ever request this pre-payment that travellers ask to see their room before handing over any money.The room was very dated, with old curtains, carpet, tiles, kitchen units etc - this is not so important in the scheme of things, but the fittings in the bathrooms were so old that the vanity basin had large dirty-looking cracks in it (not hygenic at all), the base of the toilet leaked (in the middle of the night it is hard to avoid the puddle) and the standard of housekeeping was not good. There were hairs in the basin and bath, gunge around the taps and soap-holding slots, and the toilet was old and unclean-looking. When we complained about the room not being as we had imagined from the website the receptionist ignored us and walked into the back room (I guess she gets tired of that complaint).The restaurant is over-priced. We did not eat there because we tried the coffee on our arrival (it took about 15 minutes - the waiter forgot, even though we were the only people there) - it was cold, weak and tasted like bad instant coffee.The rooftop area is very attractive, good for taking a bottle of wine up to.There were no bugs of any sort so that aspect was good, especially for that area of Sydney, which has a lot of cockroaches.Overall, I would not stay there again. However it is handy to restaurants and Kings Cross so for the price is not too bad. Just don't expect it to be beautiful.
Reviews.Author: Libertas

Reviews.Content: nothing special Having just returned from a world trip, the morgan hotel was one of the worst we stayed in , the hotel is in need of a good clean and an update.We had a load of bags and cases and nobody helped us up the steps to the hotel, after we booked in we entered the small smelly threadbare lift to our room. The room was not hoovered as there were bits all over the floor, i cleaned the bath which had pubic hair all over it!!. The area is a bit rough further down the road( sex clubs ect) but it did have some good restaurants especially across the road for breakfast and i can recommend the indian down the road about 100 metres. The hotel could be very nice but it was in need of a good paint and decoration and a good clean.
Reviews.Author: CardiffDuppers

Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of Sydney!!! From the moment my partner and I arrived at Morgans in Sydney, we were so glad we had chosen this hotel. The food was to die for, such a healthy and creative menu, and the location and service were spot on. We were looking for a stylish and funky boutique hotel as a central base for sightseeing, and that is exactly what we got! The rooftop bar area has spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House and as my partner was from the UK he was suitably impressed with the location. The hotel decor was very cool and the staff friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting great food, a central Sydney location and easy going, laid back staff. I'll definitely be back!
Reviews.Author: kylieives

Reviews.Content: Disappointing We selected this hotel on the basis of a few good reviews and its well-designed website, which made it look like an attractive boutique hotel. It wasn't. The room itself was adequate but not in great condition (in particular the bathroom needed a lot of modernisation) and it was rather noisy - we could hear everything from the adjacent room. The public areas of the hotel were dated and some of the reception staff not exactly helpful. I though the area around the hotel was pretty good - we felt safe, and there were a number of good restaurants and cafes, which helped make up for the fact that the hotel cafe was expensive and mediocre. I would not stay here again unless at a much lower price.
Reviews.Author: alexs76

Reviews.Content: Not For The Uninitiated       Bedroom
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum

Reviews.Content: Ok, but could be better ! I booked this hotel because of the description i found on Wotif, which made it sound like a quality hotel in a good area. This is not exacly true. The hotel is located very close to Kings Cross and as a result, is in a fairly seedy area. The rooms are medium size (i booked a one bedroom apartment) and are reasonably well appointed but lack some attention to detail you would expect for a 4 star hotel. The bathroom was a particular issue for me as the shower was inside the bath and the windows didn't lock !!! Also, the room the bedroom didn't seem clean and the TV channels were not tuned in properly. The mini bar was also I won't be staying here again but that is only because of the location. I would prefer to pay a little more for guaranteed quality and a good location in a bigger chain hotel.
Reviews.Author: DavidTAustralia

Reviews.Content: Nice but wouldn't stay here again We stayed at Morgans for 9 nights last month. After having read reviews, it was no different to what we had expected. Cooking facilities pretty basic but we ate out most of the time (I think we went to the same pizza place as a previous reviewer, and they were right - food was dire!) One warning - our room was at the front of the hotel and the Friday and Saturday night of our stay was extremely noisy due to the music in the bars in the street below and people screaming and shouting. I don't mind anyone having a good time but we were still lying awake at 4 am. If Morgans invested in some double glazing we might consider returning!
Reviews.Author: amwell9

Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel. Having read several trip reports before booking this hotel we knew what to expect - we were not disappointed. The room was a reasonable size - certainly not BIG as described in one report. Nice to have self-catering facilities although we didn't use them, except to boil a kettle and to eat breakfast. Hot water was always available although the towels had seen better days. The room looked out on to an enclosed central courtyard and so was rather dull and the decorations did nothing to brighten it up - but the bed was very comfortable. The area around the hotel is seedy, but not as bad as it was a few years ago - it is Kings Cross after all.Transport, both bus and train, is very close to the hotel so the tourist spots are very accessible. However, all the best and/or most interesting restaurants are around the tourist spots such as Circular Quay. Despite what some reports suggest we found no good eating places in the area of the hotel - cheap and plentiful yes, but not good. In fact, we had the worst pizza we have ever been served only 50m from the hotel's front door. But , on the other hand, we also had a good Indian! When one has been sight seeing all day, the last thing one wants to have to do is go back in the evening to those areas for dinner. Having said all that, the hotel was reasonable value for money.
Reviews.Author: Ulysees

Reviews.Content: Interesting Hotel The hotel's website set high expectation though the reality of the rooms sadly disappointed.Our room, for 4 nights, was basic and very standard.The issue is the hotel is advertised as 'boutique' on their website - which it is clearly not. This is a 3-star hotel. That said, the hotel's cafe is good quality.
Reviews.Author: FridayHut

Reviews.Content: Beware - Avoid if possible Arrived in Sydney looking forward to a 10 day break after travelling for 6 weeks. Booked this hotel through M Power Accomodation who stated that it was a 4 star hotel in a  Trendy Inner City Location with an  air of sophicitation . Firstly this was not a 4 star hotel as when we arrived we found the hotel to be of very poor quality - 2 star in our opinion and the rooms were very tired and basic. Not at all like the description and pictures from M Powers Web Site. We stay in the honeymoon suite - avoid!! There is an air conditioning power unit outside of the bedroom area which was very noisy all night - thus no sleep! We tried to ring reception but no one works at night and you have to ring an emergency number - but no one could help us. The area we found not to be trendy but was very seedy. When we spoke to our taxi driver when getting out of the hotel he confirmed that it was a very renounded bad area. Hence we can only presume the reason for the security door at the front of this hotel which is always locked. Overall should avoid this hotel and never using M Power Accomodation as in our opinion they give misleading information.
Reviews.Author: Paul072

Reviews.Content: It's okay       bathroom
Reviews.Author: AucklandVisitor

Reviews.Content: What a Pleasurable Experience My husband and I just had the pleasure of staying at Morgans Hotel in Victoria Street Darlinghurst. From the moment we stepped through the front door until we checked out we were given the royal treatment.Our room was just divine and the staff were more than willing to help make our stay as memorable as possible. From the luxurious surrounds to the exquisite food we felt as though we never wanted to leave to explore the city but when we did they even arranged for someone to sit us down and pin point all the great tourist attractions Sydney has to offer.Morgans Hotel gets my vote for the best Hotel that I have stayed in...ever. Thank you to the fabulous staff for all of your help and for the exemplary way in which you conducted yourself it was a pleasure staying with you and we will be back in the near future.Kara Whiteman
Reviews.Author: karaw

Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel Stayed here for 6 nites. Unassuming looking boutique hotel. Loved having the kitchenette. Great location, near restaurants, cafes, grocery store. Easy to get around, and walk around. The staff was helpful, rooms clean, air conditioning worked great. Only thing, our room didn't really have a view but for the price and amenities, it didn't really matter since Darlinghurst isn't on the harbor anyway. We were there for the parade and festivities so great location for everything.
Reviews.Author: RosieSFO

Reviews.Content: Just Great Stayed at Morgans last Fri thru Sun.. Reading past reviews i wasn't expecting the 5 star treatment.. But this placehad a really great feeling homey feeling perhaps a faded star..Stayed in a studio room with kitchenette completewith stove microwave and sink and plates cups etc.Room faced the interior courtyard pehaps not veryprivate for some.. But it was away from the street noise. Cablereception could have been better. Bed was comfortableand best of all an open window for air.. Check in was easy and you get your own keyas reception operates on limited times. Youcome and go as you please with very little fussReception staff not gushing with warm and fuzzies but notrude either..Location is great many many places to eat and drink alla nightowl could ask for.. I will probably return as I lovethis part of Sydney.. Booked with Qantas ready roomsand thought rate good and FF miles..If you a low maintenance guest you will enjoyif you require more pampering look elsewhere..
Reviews.Author: OZDAVE

Reviews.Content: Noisy but nice We wanted somewhere to stay in the heart of the city, with bars and restaurants all within a few yards' stroll, and with the convenience of an apartment with its own kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and balcony. Morgans provided all of this and more.The choice of reasonably-priced food and drink in Victoria Street is simply astounding and a week was not long enough to do it all justice. The inevitable downside is that there's a fair amount of late-night noise from people enjoying themselves but we managed to sleep through it (once we'd finished being out there making some of the noise ourselves, that is).Very friendly and helpful staff, the place had just been redecorated when we arrived, and all in all we were delighted with our choice and wouldn't hestitate to go back.
Reviews.Author: MikeMoss1

Reviews.Content: Location location location Safe little place to stay with great food and bars all around you. The hotel is BASIC ok so don't get too wound up if they don't deliver 5 star service you may have come to expect. It appears to be more of a family business with just a few staff. The rooms are comfortable and ours had a balcony / kichenette. They need new beds. Only other issue we had was the housekeeper. She was CRANKY !!! Other than that we loved the location, price and general facilities. No internet access in this place so dont haul the lap top away with you
Reviews.Author: dreamonixx

Reviews.Content: give it a try Stopped at this hotel 4 times since 1993 and never had a problem.Location is great as its just off Kings X with its hussle and bussle, Train to city close by. Staff always friendly and rooms clean. Rooftop patio is hardly ever used and has views of the opera house and bridge. Great to take a bottle of wine in late afternoon and just chill.Last year we decided to have a change and went to 2 other hotels in the city, both of which were worse.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Disgusting Service Unless and until they train their front service staff to welcome their guests, new and old in a more professional manner i would not recommend or step into this hotel. What good is a hotel; when you request to have a viewing of the room on behalf of a friend who's visiting sydney and who have heard so much about the beautiful place and the hotel, only to have the front office staff treating you with so much arrogance, attitude and a general lack of service. It is not free accommodation that we are requesting but merely to reconfirm and make recommendations to friends and visitors however if the experience is so bad at the very front end, be sure that your stay will not a good one either....it's a shame and i hope the management should wake up to what's happening at their front end particularly the amount of lost businesses that have been going on.hotel experience no matter big or small is about service. cordial and equal, no matter who walks through their doors. i do not even want to imagine the other socio-reasons for such an appalling attitude by this hotel staff. i'm an asian doing my masters in psychology and have been living in sydney for 2 years now. I can only hope that my short article will alert anyone particularly local or otherwise, who are considering staying in this hotel to consider elsewhere and that this hotel will wake up to the fact that a recent front page newspaper article (SMH 19 Jul 2004) have reported that their new tourism chief have reported 3 of it's worst years in tourism and is considering courting Indian tourist to the country. i wonder how this hotel or it's staff will react to a request by a huge contingent from India?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Neighborhood Place Although the location of this boutique hotel feels a bit remote and distant from some of Sydney's attractions, the underground station a few blocks away made this a nice place to stay for a few nights (on our honeymoon) while exploring the city. The neighborhood felt safe and comfortable. There was a great selection of low- to mid-range restaurants nearby. (The restaurant downstairs was pricey but the food was very good.) Staff were VERY helpful and courteous. Rooms were clean and midestly sized with a small, convenient kitchenette (supermarket is just a few blocks away).
Reviews.Author: Smartypunk
